TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit DockPattern/DockPatternInformation extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Provides access to the property values of a object using its or accessors.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The properties in this structure can also be retrieved by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPropertyValue%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCachedPropertyValue%2A>, using the corresponding identifiers from <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern>. For example, The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern.DockPatternInformation.DockPosition%2A> property is identified by the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern.DockPositionProperty> field. More information about the individual properties is available on the reference pages for those identifiers; see the link in the Remarks section of each reference topic.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the of an within a docking container.
Docs.value: The of the element, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A docking container is a control that allows the arrangement of child elements, both horizontally and vertically, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition.None>.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition> value is obtained representing the current dock position for a control that supports <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern>.
